00059 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00060 // Macros for memory allocation                                                                   //
00061 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00062 
00063 #define ALLOCATE(N,TYPE)  (TYPE *) malloc((N)*sizeof(TYPE));
00064 #define CHECK(PTR)        if ((PTR)==NULL) { fprintf(stderr, "Out of memory!\n"); exit(1); }
00065 
00066 
00067 #define ALLOCATE1D(PTR,N,TYPE)                  \
00068 {                                               \
00069   PTR = (TYPE *) malloc((N)*sizeof(TYPE));      \
00070   CHECK(PTR);                                   \
00071 }
00072 
00073 
00074 #define ALLOCATE1D_INIT(PTR,N,TYPE,VAL)                                                 \
00075 {                                                                                       \
00076   ALLOCATE1D(PTR,N,TYPE);                                                               \
00077   for (unsigned long int k=0; k<(unsigned long int)(N); k++) PTR[k] = VAL;              \
00078 }
00079 
00080 
00081 #define ALLOCATE2D(PTR,N,M,TYPE)                                        \
00082 {                                                                       \
00083   PTR = (TYPE **) malloc((N)*sizeof(TYPE *));                           \
00084   CHECK(PTR);                                                           \
00085   for (unsigned long int i=0; i<(unsigned long int)(N); i++) {          \
00086     PTR[i] = (TYPE *) malloc((M)*sizeof(TYPE));                         \
00087     CHECK(PTR[i]);                                                      \
00088   }                                                                     \
00089 }
00090 
00091 
00092 #define FREE1D(PTR)                             \
00093   if (PTR!=NULL) free(PTR);
00094 
00095 
00096 #define FREE2D(PTR,N)                                                   \
00097 {                                                                       \
00098   if ((PTR)!=NULL) {                                                    \
00099     for (unsigned long int i=0; i<(unsigned long int)(N); i++)          \
00100       if ((PTR)[i]!=NULL) free((PTR)[i]);                               \
00101     free(PTR);                                                          \
00102   }                                                                     \
00103 }
00104 
00105 
00106 
00107 #define CHECK_BOUNDS(X,DESCR,LBOUND,UBOUND)                     \
00108   { if (((X)<(LBOUND)) || ((X)>=UBOUND)) { fprintf(stderr, "Error: %s out of bounds [%d]!\n", DESCR, X); } }
00109 
00110 
00111 
00112 #define MESSAGES(STATE) { _MESSAGES_ = STATE; }

00125 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00126 // CLASS FuncTable                                                                                //
00127 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00128 
00129 class FuncTable
00130 {
00131  public:
00132   FuncTable() { nfunc = 0; }
00133   ~FuncTable() { }
00134   void Add(char *name, FuncType *f, char *description);
00135   void Execute(char *name, char *arg);
00136   void Help();
00137   FuncType *Lookup(char *name);
00138  private:
00139   int nfunc;
00140   char name[MAX_FUNCTIONS][40];
00141   char description[MAX_FUNCTIONS][200];
00142   FuncType *f[MAX_FUNCTIONS];
00143 };
00144 
00145 void Interpreter(FuncTable *FTABLE);

00160 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00161 // CLASS Fields                                                                                   //
00162 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00163 // ResetPointer    | Reset the buffer pointer                                                     //
00164 // GetNextToken    | Return next token and advance the buffer pointer                             //
00165 // GetMatrix       | Convert a buffer to a 2-dimensional array of char[]                          //
00166 // GetFloatMatrix  | Convert a buffer to a 2-dimensional array of float                           //
00167 // GetIntMatrix    | Convert a buffer to a 2-dimensional array of int                             //
00168 // GetVector       | Convert a buffer to a vector of char[]                                       //
00169 // GetFloatVector  | Convert a buffer to a vector of float                                        //
00170 // GetIntVector    | Convert a buffer to a vector of int                                          //
00171 // Clean           | Free memory occupied by the buffer                                           //
00172 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00173 
00174 class Fields 
00175 {
00176  public:
00177   Fields(char *buffer, const char *delimiters);
00178   ~Fields();
00179 
00180   void ResetPointer();
00181   char *GetNextToken(); 
00182   void Clean();
00183 
00184   // get pointers
00185   char ***GetPointers();
00186 
00187   // convert to matrix
00188   char ***GetMatrix(int *n_rows, int *n_columns);
00189   float **GetFloatMatrix(int *n_rows, int *n_columns);
00190   int **GetIntMatrix(int *n_rows, int *n_columns);
00191 
00192   // convert to vector
00193   char **GetVector(int *n_items);
00194   float *GetFloatVector(int *n_items);
00195   int *GetIntVector(int *n_items);
00196 
00197   // find a token
00198   bool Find(char *s);
00199 
00200  public:
00201   int n_rows, n_columns;
00202   long int buffer_size;
00203   char *buffer;
00204   char *pointer;
00205 };

00221 // CLASS IntList                                                                                  //

00224 // Add   | Add a new element                                                                      //
00225 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00226 
00227 struct IntNode
00228 {
00229   int val;
00230   IntNode *next;
00231 };
00232 
00233 class IntList
00234 {
00235  public:
00236   IntList();
00237   ~IntList();
00238   void Print();
00239   void Print(FILE *F);
00240   void Add(int val);
00241   void SortAdd(int val);
00242   bool Match(int *X, int n);
00243 
00244   int n;
00245   IntNode *list;
00246   IntNode *last;
00247 
00248  private:
00249   void FreeList(IntNode *L);
00250 
00251 };

00374 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00375 // TOKENIZING                                                                                     //
00376 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00377 // TokenPreprocess  | Preprocess string before tokenizing                                         //
00378 // CountTokens      | Count the number of tokens                                                  //
00379 // GetNextToken     | Get the next command line token                                             //
00380 // SkipBlank        | Skip all spaces at the beginning of the input string                        //
00381 // Read             | Read a single value from an input string                                    //
00382 // ReadVec          | Process a single vector from an input string                                //
00383 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00384 char *TokenPreprocess(char *inp, char *inp_delims, char out_delim);
00385 int CountTokens(char *s, char TOKEN_DELIM=' ');
00386 char *GetNextToken(char **pBUF, const char *DELIMS);
00387 char *GetNextToken(char **pBUF, char DELIM);
00388 char *GetNextToken(char **inp);
00389 char *SkipBlank(char *inp);
00390 void Read(char *s, float *v);
00391 void Read(char *s, double *v);
00392 void Read(char *s, int *v);
00393 void Read(char *s, long int *v);
00394 void Read(char *s, unsigned long int *v);
00395 void Read(char *s, long long int *v);
00396 template <class T> void ReadVec(char *s, T **vec, long int *n, char sep=' ');
00397 template <class T> void ReadSparseVec(char *s, T **vec, long int *n);
00398 float *ReadFloatVec(char *s, long int *n, char sep=' ');
00399 double *ReadDoubleVec(char *s, long int *n, char sep=' ');
00400 int *ReadIntVec(char *s, long int *n, char sep=' ');

00412 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00413 // VECTOR STATISTICS                                                                              //
00414 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00415 // VectorAvg     | Compute the mean value of vector v of size n                                   //
00416 // VectorStd     | Compute the standard deviation of vector v of size n                           //
00417 // VectorSum     | Compute the sum of the vector elements                                         //
00418 // VectorMax     | Compute the max value of vector v of size n                                    //
00419 // VectorMin     | Compute the min value of vector v of size n                                    //
00420 // VectorTest    | Perform a boolean test on each vector element                                  //
00421 // VectorRange   | Compute the range of a vector                                                  //
00422 // VectorNonZero | Checks if vector <> 0                                                          //
00423 // VectorCount   | Count nonempty values                                                          //
00424 // VectorVariab  | Compute vector variability measure                                             //
00425 // VectorEntropy | Compute vector entropy                                                         //
00426 // Hist          | Histogram                                                                      //
00427 // GetThreshold  | Determine a threshold for an exponentially decreasing distribution             //
00428 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00429 template <class type> type VectorAvg(type *v, int n);
00430 template <class type> type VectorStd(type *v, int n);
00431 template <class type> type VectorSum(type *v, int n);
00432 template <class type> type VectorSumSq(type *v, int n);
00433 template <class type> type VectorDiff(type *v, int n);
00434 template <class type> type VectorProd(type *v, int n);
00435 template <class type> type VectorMax(type *v, int n);
00436 template <class type> type VectorMin(type *v, int n);
00437 template <class type> int VectorTest(type *v, int n, bool (*func)(type));
00438 template <class type> type VectorRange(type *v, int n);
00439 template <class type> bool VectorNonZero(type *X, int n);
00440 template <class type> int VectorCount(type *X, int n);
00441 template <class type> float VectorL2(type *X, int n);
00442 float VectorVariab(float *X, int n);
00443 float VectorEntropy(float *X, int n, int nbins);
00444 float *Hist(float *X, int N, int n_bins, float min=0, float max=0);
00445 float GetThreshold(float *X, int n, int delta);

00455 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00456 // VECTOR OPERATIONS                                                                              //
00457 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00458 // VectorSmooth    | Return a "smoothed" version of vector x                                      //
00459 // VectorSort      | Sort the vector                                                              //
00460 // VectorRank      | Get the vector element ranking information                                   //
00461 // VectorChop      | Change values below a cutoff to NaN                                          //
00462 // VectorNorm      | Normalize vector mean to zero and standard deviation to one                  //
00463 // VectorNormMean  | Normalize vector mean to zero                                                //
00464 // VectorNormRange | Normalize the range of a vector to 1                                         //
00465 // VectorNormSum   | Normalize the sum to 1                                                       //
00466 // VectorNormSum2  | Normalize the sum of squared values to 1                                     //
00467 // VectorCut       | Return a 'cut' of the vector                                                 //
00468 // VectorPrint     | Print vector on screen                                                       //
00469 // Apply           | Apply a vector function to all rows of a matrix                              //
00470 // Pairwise        | Apply a function to all pairs of vectors in a matrix                         //
00471 // HistPairwise    | Apply a function to all pairs of vectors in a matrix & compute distribution  //
00472 // Int2Float       | Convert a vector of integer to a vector of float                             //
00473 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00474 float *VectorSmooth(float *x, int n, int d);
00475 void VectorSort(float *V, int n);
00476 void VectorSort(int *V, int n);
00477 void VectorSort(long int *V, int n);
00478 void VectorSort(unsigned long int *V, int n);
00479 void VectorSort(double *V, long int n);
00480 int *VectorRank(float *V, int n);
00481 int *VectorRank(double *V, int n);
00482 int *VectorRank(long int *V, int n);
00483 void VectorChop(float *x, int n, float cutoff);
00484 template <class type> type* VectorCopy(type *x, unsigned long int n);
00485 template <class type> void VectorNorm(type *x, unsigned long int n);
00486 template <class type> void VectorNormSum(type *x, unsigned long int n);
00487 template <class type> void VectorNormRange(type *x, int n);
00488 void VectorNormMean(float *x, int n);
00489 void VectorNormSum2(float *x, int n);
00490 float *VectorCut(float *X, int n, bool *vert_cut);
00491 float *VectorCut(float *X, int n, long int mask, int *nn);
00492 float *Apply(float **A, int N, int M, float (*func)(float *,int));
00493 float **Pairwise(float **A, int N, int M, float (*func)(float *,float *,unsigned long int));
00494 float **Pairwise(float **X, int Nx, float **Y, int Ny, int M, float (*func)(float *,float *,unsigned long int));
00495 float *HistPairwise(float **A, int N, int M, float (*func)(float *,float *,unsigned long int), int n_bins);
00496 float *HistPairwise(float **A, float **B, int Na, int Nb, int M, float (*func)(float *,float *,unsigned long int), int n_bins);
00497 float *Int2Float(int *x, int n);
00498 template <class type> void VectorPrint(type *X, int n, const char *format, bool *vert_cut=NULL, FILE *output=stdout);

00507 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00508 // VECTOR DISTANCES                                                                               //
00509 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00510 // InnerProduct    | The inner product of two vectors                                             //
00511 // Covariance      | The inner product of two vectors                                             //
00512 // Euclidean       | The euclidean distance                                                       //
00513 // VectorCorr      | Calculate the correlation of two vectors                                     //
00514 // RelativeEntropy | Calculate the relative entropy of distribution p with respect to q           //
00515 // Chi2            | Calculate the chi-square distance for vector x relative to expected values   //
00516 // Chi2std         | Calculate the chi-square distance for vector x relative to mean and stdev    //
00517 // Corr            | Calculate the correlation two vectors (handles NaN values)                   //
00518 // Hamming1        | Calculate the common 'ones' in two vectors                                   //
00519 // Jaccard         | Calculate the Jaccard of two vectors                                         //
00520 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00521 template <class type> type InnerProduct(type *A, type *B, unsigned long int n);
00522 template <class type> type Covariance(type *A, type *B, unsigned long int n);
00523 template <class type> type Euclidean(type *A, type *B, unsigned long int n);
00524 template <class type> double VectorCorr(type *A, type *B, unsigned long int n);
00525 template <class type> type RelativeEntropy(type *p, type *q, unsigned long int n);
00526 template <class type> type Chi2(type *x, type *avg, unsigned long int n);
00527 template <class type> type Chi2std(type *x, type *avg, type *std, unsigned long int n);
00528 float Jaccard(int *A, int *B, int M);
00529 float Corr(float *A, float *B, unsigned long int M);
00530 float Corr(float *A, float *B, unsigned long int *I, unsigned long int M);
00531 int Hamming1(int *x, int *y, int n);

00646 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00647 // CLASS CmdOption                                                                                   //
00648 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00649 
00650 
00651 class CmdOption 
00652 {
00653   public:
00654    CmdOption(const char *opt, const char *description);
00655    virtual ~CmdOption();
00656 
00657    // functions 
00658    virtual void Init();
00659    virtual void Print();
00660    virtual void Read(int *argc, char ***argv);
00661 
00662    // variables   
00663    char *opt;
00664    char *description;
00665 };
00666 
00667 
00668 template <class T> class CmdOptionTemplate : public CmdOption
00669 {
00670   public:
00671    CmdOptionTemplate(const char *opt, T *ptr, T val, const char *description);
00672    ~CmdOptionTemplate();
00673 
00674    // functions 
00675    virtual void Init();
00676    virtual void Print();
00677    virtual void Read(int *argc, char ***argv);
00678 
00679    // variables   
00680    T *ptr;
00681    T val;
00682 };
00683 
00684 
00685 class BoolCmdOption : public CmdOption
00686 {
00687   public:
00688    BoolCmdOption(const char *opt, bool *ptr, bool val, const char *description);
00689    ~BoolCmdOption();
00690 
00691    // functions 
00692    virtual void Init();
00693    virtual void Print();
00694    virtual void Read(int *argc, char ***argv);
00695 
00696    // variables   
00697    bool *ptr;
00698    bool val;
00699 };
00700 
00701 
00702 class StrCmdOption : public CmdOption
00703 {
00704   public:
00705    StrCmdOption(const char *opt, char **ptr, const char *val, const char *description);
00706    ~StrCmdOption();
00707 
00708    // functions 
00709    virtual void Init();
00710    virtual void Print();
00711    virtual void Read(int *argc, char ***argv);
00712 
00713    // variables   
00714    char **ptr;
00715    char *val;
00716 };

00725 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00726 // CLASS CmdLine                                                                                     //
00727 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00728 
00729 class CmdLine
00730 {
00731   public:
00732     typedef map<string,CmdOption*> OptionMap;
00733     typedef list<CmdOption*> OptionList;
00734 
00735     // constructor & destructor    
00736     CmdLine();
00737     ~CmdLine();
00738 
00739     // read & print
00740     void SetProgramName(string program_name);
00741     void Init();
00742     int Read(char **argv, int argc);
00743     void Print();
00744 
00745     // options
00746     void AddOption(CmdOption *option);
00747     void AddOption(const char *opt, char *ptr, char val, const char *description);
00748     void AddOption(const char *opt, int *ptr, int val, const char *description);
00749     void AddOption(const char *opt, unsigned long int *ptr, unsigned long int val, const char *description);
00750     void AddOption(const char *opt, long int *ptr, long int val, const char *description);
00751     void AddOption(const char *opt, bool *ptr, bool val, const char *description);
00752     void AddOption(const char *opt, float *ptr, float val, const char *description);
00753     void AddOption(const char *opt, double *ptr, double val, const char *description);
00754     void AddOption(const char *opt, char **ptr, const char *val, const char *description);
00755 
00756     // print info
00757     void Usage(const char *text);
00758     void Usage(char *prog_name, const char *usage);
00759 
00760     // data
00761     string program_name;
00762     OptionMap cmd_options;
00763     OptionList cmd_option_list;
00764 };
00765

00767 // END CLASS CmdLine                                                                                 //

00852 // SeqProduct        | Returns the inner product of two multisets                                 //

00900 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00901 // MATRIX OPERATIONS                                                                              //
00902 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00903 // ColumnConst   | Check whether column vectors are constant                                      //
00904 // ColumnSum     | Compute the sum of the values of the columns of matrix M of size n x m         //
00905 // ColumnAvg     | Compute the mean values of the columns of matrix M of size n x m               //
00906 // ColumnStd     | Compute the standard deviation of the columns of matrix M of size n x m        //
00907 // ColumnMax     | Compute the maximum of the columns of matrix M of size n x m                   //
00908 // ColumnMin     | Compute the minimum of the columns of matrix M of size n x m                   //
00909 // ColumnCount   | Count nonempty values of the columns of matrix M of size n x m                 //
00910 // ColumnNorm      | Normalize column vectors using mean and standard deviation                   //
00911 // ColumnNormMean  | Normalize column vectors to a zero mean                                      //
00912 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
00913 template <class type> bool *ColumnConst(type **M, unsigned long int n, unsigned long int m);
00914 template <class type> type *ColumnAvg(type **M, unsigned long int n, unsigned long int m);
00915 template <class type> type *ColumnSum(type **M, unsigned long int n, unsigned long int m);
00916 template <class type> type *ColumnStd(type **M, unsigned long int n, unsigned long int m);
00917 template <class type> type *ColumnMax(type **M, unsigned long int n, unsigned long int m);
00918 template <class type> type *ColumnMin(type **M, unsigned long int n, unsigned long int m);
00919 int *ColumnCount(float **M, unsigned long int n, unsigned long int m);
00920 void ColumnNorm(float **M, int n, int m);
00921 void ColumnNormMean(float **M, int n, int m);

01003 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
01004 // CLASS Matrix                                                                    //
01005 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
01006 
01007 class Matrix
01008 {
01009  public:
01010   Matrix(char *file, bool integers=false, bool verbose=false);
01011   ~Matrix();
01012   
01013   // print
01014   void Print(char *fmt="%.2f");
01015   void PrintSparse(char *fmt="%.2f", int offset=0);
01016   void PrintEncoded(int n_bins);
01017   void PrintTranspose(char *fmt="%.2f");
01018   void PrintRowStats(char *fmt="%.2f");
01019   void PrintColStats(char *fmt="%.2f");
01020   void PrintRow(int r, char *fmt="%.2f");
01021   void PrintRowPairs(char *fmt="%.2f");
01022   void PrintColLabels();
01023 
01024   // modify
01025   void ApplyCutoff(float cutoff, bool upper=false);
01026   void ApplyCutoff(int cutoff, bool upper=false);
01027   void Test(float cutoff, bool equal=true, bool greater=true);
01028   void Test(int cutoff, bool equal=true, bool greater=true);
01029   void NormRows(bool range=false);
01030   void NormCols();
01031   void Shuffle();
01032   void Multiply(float coeff);
01033 
01034   // data
01035   bool integers;
01036   int n_rows, n_cols;
01037   bool has_row_labels, has_col_labels;
01038   std::string *row_labels, *col_labels;
01039   float **val;
01040   int **ival;
01041 };

01049 
01050 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
01051 // CLASS MatrixTemplate                                                            //
01052 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------//
01053 
01054 template <class T> class MatrixTemplate
01055 {
01056  public:
01057   MatrixTemplate(char *file, bool verbose=false);
01058   ~MatrixTemplate();
01059   
01060   // functions
01061   void Print(char *fmt="%.2f");
01062   void Shrink(char *fmt="%.2f");
01063   void PrintSparse(char *fmt="%.2f", long int offset=0);
01064   void PrintEncoded(int n_bins);
01065   void PrintTranspose(char *fmt="%.2f");
01066   void PrintRowStats(char *fmt="%.2f");
01067   void PrintColStats(char *fmt="%.2f");
01068   void PrintColSums(char *fmt="%.2f");
01069   void PrintRow(int r, char *fmt="%.2f");
01070   void PrintRowPairs(char *fmt="%.2f");
01071   void PrintColLabels();
01072   void ApplyCutoff(T cutoff, bool upper=false);
01073   void Test(T cutoff, bool equal=true, bool greater=true);
01074   void Norm(T avg, T std);
01075   void NormRows(bool range=false);
01076   void NormCols();
01077   void Shuffle(gsl_rng *rnd_generator);
01078   void Multiply(T coeff);
01079   void Rel(bool first_column=false);
01080   void PrintRel2(char *fmt="%.2f");
01081   void Delete(char *fmt, T cutoff, bool equal=true, bool greater=true);
01082 
01083   // data
01084   long int n_rows, n_cols;
01085   bool has_row_labels, has_col_labels;
01086   std::string *row_labels, *col_labels;
01087   T **val;
01088 };
01089 
01090 
01091 //-------Constructor--------
01092 //
01093 template <class T> MatrixTemplate<T>::MatrixTemplate(char *file, bool verbose)
01094 {
01095   // Load file or standard input
01096   FileBuffer *buffer;
01097   long int n_lines;
01098   if (file==NULL) buffer = new FileBuffer(LoadStdIn(&n_lines));
01099   else { buffer = new FileBuffer(file); n_lines = buffer->CountLines(); }
01100   if (n_lines==0) { col_labels = row_labels = NULL; val = NULL; n_rows = n_cols = 0; return; }
01101 
01102   // check/read column labels
01103   char *inp = buffer->Next();
01104   if (strchr(inp,'\t')!=NULL) {
01105     has_row_labels = true;
01106     has_col_labels = inp[0]=='\t';
01107     n_rows = n_lines - has_col_labels;
01108     row_labels = new std::string[n_rows];
01109     if (has_col_labels==true) {
01110       GetNextToken(&inp,'\t');
01111       n_cols = CountTokens(inp,' ');
01112       col_labels = new std::string[n_cols];
01113       for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) col_labels[c] = GetNextToken(&inp,' ');
01114       inp = buffer->Next();
01115     }
01116     else {
01117       col_labels = NULL;
01118       n_cols = CountTokens(inp,' ');
01119     }
01120   }
01121   else {
01122     has_row_labels = has_col_labels = false;
01123     n_rows = n_lines;
01124     n_cols = CountTokens(inp,' ');
01125     col_labels = row_labels = NULL;
01126   }
01127 
01128   // allocate matrix memory
01129   if (verbose) fprintf(stderr, "* Found %ld lines, %ld rows and %ld columns; row labels = %s; column labels = %s.\n", n_lines, n_rows, n_cols, has_row_labels?"ON":"OFF", has_col_labels?"ON":"OFF");
01130   ALLOCATE1D(val,n_rows,T *);
01131 
01132   // read contents
01133   Progress PRG("Reading matrix entries...",n_rows);
01134   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++,inp=buffer->Next()) {
01135     bool row_label_found = strchr(inp,'\t')!=NULL;
01136     if (row_label_found!=has_row_labels) { fprintf(stderr, "Line %ld: row_label_found = %s, has_row_labels = %s\n", r+1+has_col_labels, row_label_found?"YES":"NO", has_row_labels?"YES":"NO"); exit(1); } 
01137     if (has_row_labels) row_labels[r] = GetNextToken(&inp,'\t');
01138     long int n_elem;
01139     ReadVec(inp,&val[r],&n_elem);
01140     if (n_elem!=n_cols) { fprintf(stderr, "Line %ld: vector length should be %ld!\n", r+1+has_col_labels, n_cols); exit(1); }
01141     PRG.Check();
01142   }
01143   PRG.Done();   
01144 
01145   // cleanup
01146   delete buffer;
01147 }
01148 
01149 
01150 
01151 //-------Destructor--------
01152 //
01153 template <class T> MatrixTemplate<T>::~MatrixTemplate()
01154 {
01155   if (row_labels!=NULL) delete [] row_labels;
01156   if (col_labels!=NULL) delete [] col_labels;
01157   FREE2D(val,n_rows);
01158 }
01159 
01160 
01161 
01162 //-------Print--------
01163 //
01164 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Print(char *fmt)
01165 {
01166   if (has_col_labels==true) {
01167     if (has_row_labels) printf("\t");
01168     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) std::cout << col_labels[c] << ' ';
01169     printf("\n");
01170   }
01171   Progress PRG("Printing matrix...",n_rows);
01172   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01173     if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r] << '\t';
01174     PrintRow(r,fmt);
01175     printf("\n");
01176     PRG.Check();
01177   }
01178   PRG.Done();   
01179 }
01180 
01181 
01182 
01183 //-------Shrink--------
01184 //
01185 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Shrink(char *fmt)
01186 {
01187   if (n_rows==0) return;
01188   bool *keep = new bool[n_cols];
01189   for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) {
01190     keep[c] = false;
01191     for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) if ((val[r][c]==val[r][c])&&(val[r][c]!=0)) { keep[c] = true; break; }
01192   }
01193   if (has_col_labels==true) {
01194     if (has_row_labels) printf("\t");
01195     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) if (keep[c]==true) std::cout << col_labels[c] << ' ';
01196     printf("\n");
01197   }
01198   Progress PRG("Printing matrix...",n_rows);
01199   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01200     if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r] << '\t';
01201     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) if (keep[c]==true) {
01202       if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) printf(fmt, val[r][c]); else printf("NaN");
01203       printf(" ");
01204     }
01205     printf("\n");
01206     PRG.Check();
01207   }
01208   PRG.Done();
01209   delete keep;
01210 }
01211 
01212 
01213 
01214 //-------PrintSparse--------
01215 //
01216 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintSparse(char *fmt, long int offset)
01217 {
01218   Progress PRG("Printing in sparse format...",n_rows);
01219   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01220     if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r] << '\t';
01221     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) 
01222       if ((val[r][c]==val[r][c])&&(val[r][c]!=0)) { printf("%ld:", offset+c); printf(fmt, val[r][c]); printf(" "); } 
01223     printf("\n");
01224     PRG.Check();
01225   }
01226   PRG.Done();
01227 }
01228 
01229 
01230 
01231 //-------PrintEncoded--------
01232 //
01233 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintEncoded(int n_bins)
01234 {
01235   Progress PRG("Printing in encoded format...",n_rows);
01236   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01237     if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r] << '\t';
01238     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) printf("%ld ", (long int)c*n_bins+(long int)val[r][c]);
01239     printf("\n");
01240     PRG.Check();
01241   }
01242   PRG.Done();
01243 }
01244 
01245 
01246 
01247 //-------PrintTranspose--------
01248 //
01249 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintTranspose(char *fmt)
01250 {
01251   if (has_row_labels==true) {
01252     if (has_col_labels) printf("\t");
01253     for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) std::cout << row_labels[r] << ' ';
01254     printf("\n");
01255   }
01256   Progress PRG("Printing matrix...",n_cols);
01257   for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) {
01258     if (has_col_labels) std::cout << col_labels[c] << '\t';
01259     for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01260       if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) printf(fmt, val[r][c]); else printf("NaN");
01261       printf(" ");
01262     }
01263     printf("\n");
01264     PRG.Check();
01265   }
01266   PRG.Done();   
01267 }
01268 
01269 
01270 
01271 //-------PrintColStats--------
01272 //
01273 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintColStats(char *fmt)
01274 {
01275   // compute statistics
01276   T *sum = ColumnSum(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01277   T *min = ColumnMin(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01278   T *max = ColumnMax(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01279   T *avg = ColumnAvg(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01280   T *std = ColumnStd(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01281 
01282   // print statistics
01283   if (has_col_labels==true) {
01284     printf("\t");
01285     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) std::cout << col_labels[c] << ' ';
01286     printf("\n");
01287   }
01288   printf("SUM\t"); for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) { printf(fmt, sum[c]); printf(" "); }; printf("\n");
01289   printf("MIN\t"); for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) { printf(fmt, min[c]); printf(" "); }; printf("\n");
01290   printf("MAX\t"); for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) { printf(fmt, max[c]); printf(" "); }; printf("\n");
01291   printf("AVG\t"); for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) { printf(fmt, avg[c]); printf(" "); }; printf("\n");
01292   printf("STD\t"); for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) { printf(fmt, std[c]); printf(" "); }; printf("\n");
01293 
01294   // free memory
01295   FREE1D(sum);
01296   FREE1D(avg);
01297   FREE1D(std);
01298   FREE1D(min);
01299   FREE1D(max);
01300 }
01301 
01302 
01303 
01304 //-------PrintColSums--------
01305 //
01306 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintColSums(char *fmt)
01307 {
01308   // return 0, if matrix is empty
01309   if (n_rows==0) { printf(fmt, 0); printf("\n"); return; }
01310 
01311   // compute statistics
01312   T *sum = ColumnSum(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01313 
01314   // print statistics
01315   if (has_col_labels==true) {
01316     printf("\t");
01317     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) std::cout << col_labels[c] << ' ';
01318     printf("\n");
01319   }
01320   for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) { printf(fmt, sum[c]); printf(" "); }; printf("\n");
01321 
01322   // free memory
01323   FREE1D(sum);
01324 }
01325 
01326 
01327 
01328 //-------PrintRowStats--------
01329 //
01330 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintRowStats(char *fmt)
01331 {
01332   // print statistics
01333   printf("\tSUM\tMIN\tMAX\tAVG\tSTD\tSTD/AVG\tCOUNT\n");
01334   Progress PRG("Printing row statistics...",n_rows);
01335   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01336     if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r] << '\t';
01337     printf(fmt, VectorSum(val[r],n_cols)); printf("\t");
01338     printf(fmt, VectorMin(val[r],n_cols)); printf("\t");
01339     printf(fmt, VectorMax(val[r],n_cols)); printf("\t");
01340     printf(fmt, VectorAvg(val[r],n_cols)); printf("\t");
01341     printf(fmt, VectorStd(val[r],n_cols)); printf("\t");
01342     printf(fmt, VectorStd(val[r],n_cols)/VectorAvg(val[r],n_cols)); printf("\t");
01343     printf("%ld", n_cols);
01344     printf("\n");
01345     PRG.Check();
01346   }
01347   PRG.Done();   
01348 }
01349 
01350 
01351 
01352 //-------PrintRowPairs--------
01353 //
01354 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintRowPairs(char *fmt)
01355 {
01356   Progress PRG("Printing row pairs...",n_rows);
01357   for (long int r1=0; r1<n_rows; r1++) {
01358     for (long int r2=r1+1; r2<n_rows; r2++) {
01359       if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r1] << '\t' << row_labels[r2] << '\t';
01360       PrintRow(r1,fmt);
01361       std::cout << '\t';
01362       PrintRow(r2,fmt);
01363       printf("\n");
01364     }
01365     PRG.Check();
01366   }
01367   PRG.Done();   
01368 }
01369 
01370 
01371 
01372 //-------PrintRow--------
01373 //
01374 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintRow(int r, char *fmt)
01375 {
01376   for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) {
01377     if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) printf(fmt, val[r][c]); else printf("NaN");
01378     printf(" ");
01379   }
01380 }
01381 
01382 
01383 
01384 //-------PrintColLabels--------
01385 //
01386 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintColLabels()
01387 {
01388   if (has_row_labels==true) std::cout << '\t';
01389   for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) std::cout << col_labels[c] << ' ';
01390   std::cout << '\n';
01391 }
01392 
01393 
01394 
01395 //-------ApplyCutoff--------
01396 //
01397 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::ApplyCutoff(T cutoff, bool upper)
01398 {
01399   Progress PRG("Applying cutoff...",n_rows);
01400   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01401     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++)
01402       if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) {
01403         if (upper) val[r][c] = val[r][c]>cutoff ? cutoff:val[r][c];
01404         else val[r][c] = val[r][c]<cutoff ? cutoff:val[r][c];
01405       }
01406     PRG.Check();
01407   }
01408   PRG.Done();
01409 }
01410 
01411 
01412 
01413 //-------Test--------
01414 //
01415 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Test(T cutoff, bool equal, bool greater)
01416 {
01417   Progress PRG("Applying test...",n_rows);
01418   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01419     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) {
01420       if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) {
01421         if ((equal==true)&&(val[r][c]==cutoff)) { val[r][c] = 1; continue; }
01422         if ((greater==true)&&(val[r][c]>cutoff)) { val[r][c] = 1; continue; }
01423         if ((greater==false)&&(val[r][c]<cutoff)) { val[r][c] = 1; continue; }
01424         val[r][c] = 0;
01425       }
01426     }
01427     PRG.Check();
01428   }
01429   PRG.Done();   
01430 }
01431 
01432 
01433 
01434 //-------Delete--------
01435 //
01436 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Delete(char *fmt, T cutoff, bool equal, bool greater)
01437 {
01438   Progress PRG("Deleting rows...",n_rows);
01439   long int *selected = new long int[n_rows];
01440   long int n_selected = 1;
01441   selected[0] = 0;
01442   if (has_col_labels==true) {
01443     if (has_row_labels) printf("\t");
01444     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) std::cout << col_labels[c] << ' ';
01445     printf("\n");
01446   }
01447   if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[0] << '\t';
01448   PrintRow(0,fmt);
01449   printf("\n");
01450   for (long int r=1; r<n_rows; r++) {
01451     bool add = true;
01452     for (long int z=0; z<n_selected; z++) {
01453       double corr = VectorCorr(val[r],val[selected[z]],n_cols);
01454       if ((equal==true)&&(corr==cutoff)) { add = false; break; }
01455       if ((greater==true)&&(corr>cutoff)) { add = false; break; }
01456       if ((greater==false)&&(corr<cutoff)) { add = false; break; }
01457     }
01458     if (add==true) {
01459       selected[n_selected++] = r;
01460       if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r] << '\t';
01461       PrintRow(r,fmt);
01462       printf("\n");
01463     }
01464     PRG.Check();
01465   }
01466   PRG.Done();   
01467   if (_MESSAGES_) fprintf(stderr, "* selected %ld rows.\n", n_selected);
01468   delete selected;
01469 }
01470 
01471 
01472 
01473 //-------Norm--------
01474 //
01475 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Norm(T avg, T std)
01476 {
01477   Progress PRG("Normalizing rows...",n_rows);
01478   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01479     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) val[r][c] = (val[r][c]-avg)/std;
01480     PRG.Check();
01481   }
01482   PRG.Done();
01483 }
01484 
01485 
01486 //-------NormRows--------
01487 //
01488 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::NormRows(bool range)
01489 {
01490   Progress PRG("Normalizing rows...",n_rows);
01491   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01492     if (range) VectorNormRange(val[r],n_cols);
01493     else VectorNorm(val[r],n_cols);
01494     PRG.Check();
01495   }
01496   PRG.Done();
01497 }
01498 
01499 
01500 //-------NormCols--------
01501 //
01502 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::NormCols()
01503 {
01504   T *avg = ColumnAvg(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01505   T *std = ColumnStd(val,n_rows,n_cols);
01506   Progress PRG("Normalizing columns...",n_rows);
01507   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01508     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) 
01509       if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) val[r][c] = (val[r][c]-avg[c])/std[c];
01510     PRG.Check();
01511   }
01512   PRG.Done();
01513   FREE1D(avg);
01514   FREE1D(std);
01515 }
01516 
01517 
01518 //-------Shuffle--------
01519 //
01520 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Shuffle(gsl_rng *rnd_generator)
01521 {
01522   Progress PRG("Shuffling rows...",n_rows);
01523   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01524     gsl_ran_shuffle(rnd_generator,val[r],n_cols,sizeof(T));
01525     PRG.Check();
01526   }
01527   PRG.Done();
01528 }
01529 
01530 
01531 //-------Multiply--------
01532 //
01533 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Multiply(T coeff)
01534 {
01535   Progress PRG("Multiplying...",n_rows);
01536   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01537     for (long int c=0; c<n_cols; c++) if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) val[r][c] *= coeff;
01538     PRG.Check();
01539   }
01540   PRG.Done();
01541 }
01542 
01543 
01544 //-------Rel--------
01545 //
01546 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::Rel(bool first_column)
01547 {
01548   Progress PRG("Fold enrichment...",n_rows);
01549   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01550     for (long int c=n_cols-1; c>=1; c--) if (val[r][c]==val[r][c]) val[r][c] /= first_column==true?val[r][0]:val[r][c-1];
01551     PRG.Check();
01552   }
01553   PRG.Done();
01554 }
01555 
01556 
01557 //-------PrintRel2--------
01558 //
01559 template <class T> void MatrixTemplate<T>::PrintRel2(char *fmt)
01560 {
01561   Progress PRG("Fold enrichment...",n_rows);
01562   if (has_col_labels==true) {
01563     printf("\t");
01564     for (long int c0=0; c0<n_cols-1; c0++) 
01565       for (long int c=c0+1; c<n_cols; c++) std::cout << col_labels[c] << '/' << col_labels[c0] << ' ';
01566     printf("\n");
01567   }
01568   for (long int r=0; r<n_rows; r++) {
01569     if (has_row_labels) std::cout << row_labels[r] << '\t';
01570     for (long int c0=0; c0<n_cols-1; c0++) 
01571       for (long int c=c0+1; c<n_cols; c++) { printf(fmt, val[r][c]/val[r][c0]); printf(" "); }
01572     printf("\n");
01573     PRG.Check();
01574   }
01575   PRG.Done();
01576 }
